intro: Alomia microcephala, commonly known as the dwarf alomia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and clusters of fragrant, white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
